attributes.action: allow married pensioner couples whatever age to get a joint tax allowance.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I AM VERY UNHAPPY RE THE DIGUSTINGLY LOW LEVEL OF THE "MARRIED COUPLES TAX ALLOWANCE". .AS I UNDERSTAND THIS BOTH MEN AND THEIR WIVES HAVE TO BE OVER 65 TO CLAIM THE JOINT ALLOWANCE OF £18060 BEFORE BEING TAXED. MY PETITION TO GORDON BROWN IS AS FOLLOWS."REDUCE THE THE WOMAN`S AGE TO 60 AND NOT 65 AS PROPOSED."
MY ARGUMENT IS THAT I HAVE PAID INCOME TAX & NHI FOR 49 YEARS AND MY WIFE HAS PAID TAX FOR 43 YEARS AND OUR JOINT INCOME AT THE PRESENT TIME IS £17248.18P AND I CALCULATE I SHALL BE PAYING OVER £500 IN TAX PER ANNUM WHEN MY OWN EARNINGS FOR THE YEAR ARE £11329. WOULD YOU BE KIND ENOUGH TO RECONSIDER PLEASE AND STOP TAXING PEOPLE SUCH AS MY WIFE AND MYSELF AND ALTER THE PRESENT ALLOWANCE SO THAT THE ALLOWANCE FOR MARRIED WOMEN CAN BE CLAIMED WHEN THEY REACH THE AGE OF 60 AND NOT WAIT UNTIL THEY ARE 65
 
 
FROM A VERY UNHAPPY TAX PAYER

rejection.details: Please address the excessive use of capital letters; they make your petition hard to read.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
